definition: to rub/to grind/to polish/to sharpen/to wear down/to die out/to waste time/to pester/to insist

sentences.english: I'm not speaking as someone who has been through the mill and picked and chosen my games.
sentences.chinese: 我不会像一个历尽磨难的人说，去选择我的比赛。

sentences.english: I expressed my commiserations on his tribulation.
sentences.chinese: 我对他的磨难表示同情。

sentences.english: Mr. Rochon has suffered for his art in other ways.
sentences.chinese: 罗雄先生在其他的方面也为其艺术遭受了磨难。

sentences.english: The vicissitudes, the wind and rain is rough, the great motherland experiences the tribulation.
sentences.chinese: 沧海桑田，风雨坎坷，伟大的祖国历尽磨难。

sentences.english: Most family went throught a lot during the war.
sentences.chinese: 战争期间许多家庭都经历了很多痛苦磨难。

sentences.english: The Shelleys moved restlessly from place to place, and they suffered much unhappiness.
sentences.chinese: 雪莱一家经常到处迁徙，并经受了种种磨难。

sentences.english: Seeking to flee from punishment, he only brought more suffering upon himself.
sentences.chinese: 他试图逃脱惩罚，却给自己招致更多的磨难。

sentences.english: I realized that I hadn't been improving my Xinxing as the tribulations came like before.
sentences.chinese: 我意识到，当磨难来的时候，我没有提高自己的心性。

sentences.english: Gone through life and death, suffering, Ma Cuifen finally helm Tang.
sentences.chinese: 历尽生死磨难，马翠芬终于执掌唐家。

sentences.english: Through many whetting difficult, settle down in Hong Kong finally, open a small business.
sentences.chinese: 经过许多磨难，终于在香港安顿下来，开了个小买卖。

sentences.english: The elder always told the hardships he onced experienced in a soft and soothing voice .
sentences.chinese: 老人总是用一种温和镇定的语气讲述当年经历的磨难。

sentences.english: Gypsies have endured almost every form of discrimination.
sentences.chinese: 吉普赛人可谓是经历了各种歧视和磨难。

sentences.english: The hope of immigrants setting out for distant shores.
sentences.chinese: 那是远渡重洋，历经磨难来到这里的移民们的希望。

sentences.english: But we must buoy up, is enduring the tribulation, goes forward unceasingly.
sentences.chinese: 但我们必须重新振作起来，忍受着磨难，不断前进。

sentences.english: Your father and I learned this the hard way.
sentences.chinese: 几经磨难，我们才明白这个道理。

sentences.english: In order to overcome them, one must keep faith.
sentences.chinese: 欲求经此磨难，则必须坚持信念，大众一心。

definition: setback/reverse/check/defeat/frustration/disappointment/to frustrate/to discourage/to set sb back/to blunt/to subdue
bumpy (of a road)/rough (of life)/to be down on one's luck/to be full of frustrations and dashed hopes
to have experienced a lot of/to have been through
variant of 磨難|磨难[mo2 nan4]
to go through thick and thin (idiom)
to suffer enough from/to suffer all kinds of/to have one's fill of
